Package com.github.actionfx.core.annotation

Annotation Type AFXOnAction

  • @Retention(RUNTIME)
@Documented
@Target(METHOD)
public @interface AFXOnAction
    Annotated methods are invoked when the node or control specified with fires ActionEvent. This is e.g. when the user clicks on Button.

    Annotated methods can be of the following signature:

    • void methodName()
    • void methodName(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    You can also combine this annotation with annotation AFXControlValue:
    • void methodName(@AFXControlValue("usernameTextField") String username)
    In this case, the user value entered in text field with ID 'usernameTextField' will be injected as method argument.
    Author:
    koster

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element Description
      java.lang.String nodeId
      ID of the node whose action property shall be set to execute the annotated method.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      boolean async
      Optional flag that determines, whether the annotated method shall be executed in an asynchronous fashion.

    • Element Detail

      • nodeId

        java.lang.String nodeId
        ID of the node whose action property shall be set to execute the annotated method.
        Returns:
        the node ID, whose action property will invoke the annotated method.

      • async

        boolean async
        Optional flag that determines, whether the annotated method shall be executed in an asynchronous fashion. When set to true, the annotated method is not executed inside the JavaFX-thread, but in its own thread in order not to block the JavaFX thread. In case that UI components need to be updated in the method, the update itself needs to be run with Platform.runLater(Runnable).
        Returns:
        true,if method execution shall be performed from a new thread, false, if the method shall be executed synchronously inside the JavaFX thread. Default is false.
        Default:
        false
